document.docAuthor: Markhaseva, Elena L., Schulz, Knud & Arbizu, Pedro Martinez
document.docTitle: Rostrocalanus cognatus Markhaseva & Schulz & Arbizu 2008, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: New family and genus Rostrocalanus gen. nov. (Crustacea: Calanoida: Rostrocalanidae fam. nov.) from deep Atlantic waters

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New family and genus Rostrocalanus gen. nov. (Crustacea: Calanoida: Rostrocalanidae fam. nov.) from deep Atlantic waters

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype
. Adult female, dissected, body length 1.80 mm ( ZMH K-41626); tropical Atlantic,
22 ° 20 9 S
,
003 ° 18 9 E
, station 318,
9 July 2000
, above the seabed at a depth of
5125 m
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Paratypes
. Three adult females, dissected, body length 1.75–1.90 mm ( ZMH K- 41627),
17 ° 06 9 S
,
004 ° 42 9 E
, station 344,
25 July 2000
, above the seabed at a depth of
5415 m
.
One adult female, undissected, in poor condition, body length 1.75 mm (
ZIN 91089
),
18 ° 19 9 S
,
004 ° 40 9 E
, station 338,
22 July 2000
, above the seabed at a depth of
5397 m
.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 4.
Rostrocalanus cognatus
sp. nov. Female. (A) Habitus, lateral; (B) habitus, dorsal; (C) cephalosome, lateral; (D) rostrum, ventral; (E) posterior prosome and urosome, right lateral, with spermatophore; (F) posterior prosome and urosome, left lateral, with spermatophore; (G) urosome, dorsal; (H) posterior prosome, genital double somite and urosome segment 2, dorsal; (J) genital double somite, ventral; (K–N) posterior prosome and genital double somite, lateral. (D–F, J) Holotype, (A–C, H, K–N) paratype. Scale bars: 0.1 mm.

Figure 5.
Rostrocalanus cognatus
sp. nov. Female. (A) Antenna; (B) mandible; (C) mandible, exopod; (D, E) mandible, gnathobase; (F) maxillule; (G) maxilla, praecoxa and coxa; (H) maxilla, basis and endopod. (A, B, D, F) Holotype, (C, E, G, H) paratype. Scale bars: 0.1 mm.

Figure 6.
Rostrocalanus cognatus
sp. nov. Female. (A) Antennule, segments I–XVIII; (B) antennule, segments XIX–XXVIII; (C) antennule, segments XXVII–XXVIII; (D) maxilliped; (E) P1, right; (F) P1, left endopod; (G) P2; (H) P3; (J) P4, coxa, basis, exopod segment 1 and endopod; (K) P4, exopod; (L) P5. (C–J, L) Holotype, (A, B, K) paratype. Scale bars: 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
The specific name is derived from the Latin
cognatus
meaning similar, and refers to the general resemblance of this species to the type species of the new genus.

An additional single female of
Rostrocalanus cf. cognatus
was found in sample 016–10 collected by RV Polarstern during the ANDEEP III expedition at depths of
4469–4725 m
(
41 ° 08 9 S
,
009 ° 56 9 E
), collected on
26 January 2005
. The precise affiliation to the species could not be verified because of its poor condition
.
